title: Investing Strategies for Your 50s
subtitle: Discover a tailored approach to investing that aligns with your financial situation as you enter retirement.
content:
Investing Strategies for Your 50s

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. If any of this resonates with you, sign up for my free newsletter by clicking the link in my bio.

1. Forget Your Age

I would start by forgetting about my age and investing based on some archaic formula. Thatâ€™s the wrong place from which to start. You are not the same 50-year-old sitting next to you.

2. Focus on Lifestyle Sustainability

Instead, I would ask only one question: Can I afford to live off of 4% or 5% of my current asset base?

3. If Yes, Principal Protection and Wealth Preservation

If the answer is yes, then I would focus on creating a portfolio entirely based on principal protection and wealth preservation. An ideal allocation could be: 50% fixed income, 30% blue-chip dividend funds, 10% real estate investment trusts, and 10% cash equivalents.

4. If Likely Within 5-10 Years, Balanced Portfolio

If the answer was not quite but I probably will be able to in about 5 to 10 years, I would focus on creating a balanced portfolio that mitigates downside risk while maintaining healthy growth. A possible allocation: 30% growth stocks, 10% dividend stocks, 30% fixed income, 20% real estate investment trusts, and 10% cash equivalents.

5. If a Hard No, Growth Portfolio

If the answer was a hard no, then I would continue to focus on a growth portfolio: 50% growth stocks, 30% dividend stocks, 10% fixed income, and 10% cash equivalents.

Conclusion

And as always, that's just me. You do you!
